`new Observable({})`

constructor, it is **obsolete** since v3.0,
and you have to migrate to the "data/observable"
`fromObject({})`
or the
`fromObjectRecursive({})`
functions.

A property bag holding suspended native updates.

or the view was detached from the visual tree etc. will accumulate in this object,
and will be applied when all prerequisites are met.

Set the nativeView field performing extra checks and updates to the native properties on the new view.
Use in cases where the createNativeView is not suitable.
As an example use in item controls where the native parent view will create the native views for child items.
Performs the core logic of adding a child view to the native visual tree. Returns true if the view's native representation has been successfully added, false otherwise.

content.text: A widget can call this method to add a matching css pseudo class.
A widget can call this method to discard matching css pseudo class.
Ensures a dom-node for this view.

summary.text:
Determines the depth of suspended updates.
When the value is 0 the current property updates are not batched nor scoped and must be immediately applied.
If the value is 1 or greater, the current updates are batched and does not have to provide immediate update.
Do not set this field, the _batchUpdate method is responsible to keep the count up to date,
as well as adding/rmoving the view to/from the visual tree.

Determines the depth of suspended updates.
When the value is 0 the current property updates are not batched nor scoped and must be immediately applied.
If the value is 1 or greater, the current updates are batched and does not have to provide immediate update.
Do not set this field, the _batchUpdate method is responsible to keep the count up to date,
as well as adding/rmoving the view to/from the visual tree.
Allow multiple updates to be performed on the instance at once.

When returning true the callLoaded method will be run in setTimeout
Method is intended to be overridden by inheritors and used as "protected"

signatures.code: on(eventNames: string, callback: (data: EventData) => void, thisArg?: any): any

summary.text: A basic method signature to hook an event listener (shortcut alias to the addEventListener method).
String corresponding to events (e.g. "propertyChange"). Optionally could be used more events separated by
(e.g. "propertyChange", "change").
Callback function which will be executed when event is raised.
An optional parameter which will be used as
`this`
context for callback execution.

signatures.code: on(event: "propertyChange", callback: (data: EventData) => void, thisArg?: any): any

summary.text: Raised when a propertyChange occurs.

signatures.code: once(event: string, callback: (data: EventData) => void, thisArg?: any): any

summary.text: Adds one-time listener function for the event named
`event`
Name of the event to attach to.
A function to be called when the specified event is raised.
An optional parameter which when set will be used as "this" in callback method call.

signatures.code: off(eventNames: string, callback?: any, thisArg?: any): any

summary.text: Shortcut alias to the removeEventListener method.

signatures.code: addEventListener(eventNames: string, callback: (data: EventData) => void, thisArg?: any): any

summary.text: Adds a listener for the specified event name.
Comma delimited names of the events to attach the listener to.
A function to be called when some of the specified event(s) is raised.
An optional parameter which when set will be used as "this" in callback method call.

signatures.code: removeEventListener(eventNames: string, callback?: any, thisArg?: any): any

summary.text: Removes listener(s) for the specified event name.
Comma delimited names of the events the specified listener is associated with.
An optional parameter pointing to a specific listener. If not defined, all listeners for the event names will be removed.
An optional parameter which when set will be used to refine search of the correct callback which will be removed as event listener.
Updates the specified property with the provided value.
Updates the specified property with the provided value and raises a property change event and a specific change event based on the property name.
Gets the value of the specified property.
Notifies all the registered listeners for the event provided in the data.eventName.
The data associated with the event.

signatures.code: notifyPropertyChange(propertyName: string, value: any, oldValue?: any): void

summary.text: Notifies all the registered listeners for the property change event.
Checks whether a listener is registered for the specified event name.
The name of the event to check for.
This method is intended to be overriden by inheritors to provide additional implementation.
Filed to use instead of instanceof ViewBase.
Filed to use instead of instanceof ViewBase.
